storyInfo: A well-known painter dies after finishing a work titled 'Death of the Witch King.' Viviana runs into Arturia in front of the painting. The art gallery is attacked, and the Gendarmerie captain discovers it is Federico's doing as he pursues Arturia.

attributes.content: The nights spent up in the spire were always quiet, compared to the clamor of the city.
The cheers grow increasingly loud as elegantly dressed musicians leave one by one with their instruments in tow. She remains the last one in the vehicle.
'Don't be afraid, Viviana.' Someone walks over and holds her hand. 'Kazimierz and Leithanien aren't the same, but you'll get used to it.'
She nods obediently and follows the crowd out of the car.
Still, she subconsciously closes her eyes as the neon lights of the Grand Knight Territory pierce her vision.
She's never told this to anyone, but back then, it wasn't the strange new country she was so afraid of.
After all, her impression of Leithanien came solely from the window in her room, less than a square meter wide. It's hard to say that she knew the country all that well.
What she found so frightening was that the seemingly noisy evening outside might not actually be so different from the small slice of the night in her memories.
Viviana.
Are you alright, Viviana?
...Frau Löwenstein.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I'm reminded of when I first arrived in Kazimierz. Back then... you were holding my hand, just like now.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Your palms are all sweaty. What happened?
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I... It's nothing. I just chatted with a strange woman.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I stopped by Graf Josef's office earlier, but I only sensed your presence when I arrived here.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: She didn't do anything to me, and showed no hostility either. I think she simply came for the paintings too.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Right, about the paintings...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Hmm.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Ah, I'm sorry. Should I describe what they look like for you?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: No, please avert your eyes from them.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Is there something wrong with them?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Their odor.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: During the Witch King's reign, people were far more enthusiastic about Originium research than they are today. The casters, or should I say, artists on the side of the Witch King, saw it as more than just an energy source, or a material for conducting Arts.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: They believed that Originium was another form of flesh and blood, and could serve as a medium for the soul.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: So you're saying, the black substance on the paintings is...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Refined Originium crystals mixed with the artist's blood.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: It sounds like this 'exhibit' was rather well thought out.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Go cover up the paintings. Use the heaviest fabric you can, and be sure not to touch the frames.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Understood.
attributes.name: Gendarmerie

attributes.content: I think the two of you should leave as soon as possible. The intruder has yet to be found, so the art gallery isn't safe.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: It's not just us who are in danger.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: The people living in this city... everyone needs to be alerted.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: The ones who caused Frau Seemann's death and used her to paint these works are most likely...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Please, don't say the name.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Frau Löwenstein, Das Kaiserinnensfest is just around the corner, and you know better than anyone that Their Majesties wouldn't want to see Zwillingstürme fall into chaos.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Which is why we're here.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: ...Can you at least inform the people who came to the gallery earlier?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I worry for their mental state after seeing such horrific paintings.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: How kind of you.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: I've already dispatched people to check on the crowd who came today, so don't worry. I also hope they didn't get too close a look.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: ...Herr Vizegraf.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I don't want Frau Seemann to have died a dubious death.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: She was a guest at His Majesty's spire on that night twenty-three years ago, correct?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: She witnessed firsthand the fall of the Witch King, and the birth of our national heroes.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: ...I see.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: But what of it?
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Believe me, meine Dame, on that night, the youths congregating before that pitch-black spiral spire weren't the only ones thirsting for dawn to break... There were many, many more.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Moreover, most of them did not become the heroes they thought they would be, the brave souls delivering Leithanien's rebirth.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Now, I've gotten an update on my intruder, so if you'll excuse me.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: He's right. That night changed many things, but change... isn't necessarily good.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: The remnants may have planned Frieda Seemann's death as punishment for 'betraying' the Witch King, or maybe it was meant to send a signal announcing a major move.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: ...Did they kill my father for the same reason?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Meine Dame.
attributes.name: Strange Voice From A Sculpture

attributes.content: Shh.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Let me finish listening to this piece.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: It's just the performance of a vagrant.
attributes.name: Strange Voice From A Sculpture

attributes.content: He was playing the same melody this morning, but now with such a different mood.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: He expected the gallery to be full of visitors today, and was planning to have a sandwich for dinner with an extra bratwurst to go.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: But now he realizes that he might have to go to bed hungry, yet again.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Did you... probe into his mind with your Arts?
attributes.name: Strange Voice From A Sculpture

attributes.content: No need for that. Haven't you noticed? The homeless gentleman is telling his story right now through his music, again and again. All I'm doing is paying attention.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: ...His story has nothing to do with us, though. The next stage has already been set.
attributes.name: Strange Voice From A Sculpture

attributes.content: The stone sculpture by the flowerbed ceases to speak.
Instead of words, it now hums a tune, smooth and deep, from the vibrating structure within.
You Leithanians really do fancy your sound-producing sculptures.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: They give a 'perfect' performance every time, but it lacks soul... just like the people trapped in the spires.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Arturia gently blows a petal towards the mouthpiece of a large musical instrument carved into a sculpture.
It rises and falls with the airflow, and the formerly uniform tune immediately changes, ever so slightly.
Much better.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Captain! We were so close to catching the intruder, but he suddenly disappeared on us!
attributes.name: Gendarmerie

attributes.content: Are the roads outside still under lockdown?
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Ja. He can't possibly have grown wings and flown over us, can he?
attributes.name: Gendarmerie

attributes.content: Wings... heh, hard to say.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: We... We've really let you down, Captain. Encountering such a setback just when you're just about to—
attributes.name: Gendarmerie

attributes.content: It's fine, Pym. Go find Graf Josef and tell him what's going on with the art gallery.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Incidentally... I haven't heard the sound of gunfire in a long, long time.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: I've never been qualified to wield one, even back in my Laterano days. But I can assure you that the wands we use in the Gendarmerie hit just as hard and true.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: So, before my men return, you'd best put away your firearm... and your other weapons.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: And then, explain—
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: What business brings a Sankta like you to Zwillingstürme?
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Loris Bordin.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Oh? You recognize me.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Former Lateran citizen. Twenty-eight years ago, you came to Leithanien from Laterano and joined the Gendarmerie.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Twenty-three years ago, the Twin Empresses conferred you the title of Vizegraf, and afterwards you became the commander of the Gendarmerie, a position you still occupy to this day.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: ...Hah. I was counting on you to introduce yourself first.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: I require your assistance in bringing an important fugitive back to Laterano.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Fugitive?
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Her name is Arturia.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: ...Now I remember.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: You're that... executor from the Curia's Fifth Tribunal, the Notarial Hall's Fe... Fe... I'm sorry, the list of titles on your sign-offs is always so long, I can't recall your actual name.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Federico Giallo.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Our dealings are considered international affairs, so according to protocol, signatures are to be as meticulous as possible.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Ha... haha... The dozen or so letters you sent to me are still—
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Twenty-seven letters.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Did you read them properly? Did you even open them at all?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: *ahem!* How could I... Anyway, you wrote all those letters over the past few years, and even personally came to Lethanien, just to hunt down this fugitive, yes?
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: She has been active in Leithanien for many years now. I have reason to believe she is related to numerous unusual cases occurring here, including many of the cases you're currently working on.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: First it was His late Majesty, and now a fugitive from Laterano... When it rains, it pours, I suppose.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Do you require a briefing on the suspect and her situation from the very beginning? Alternatively, you may read any of the letters I sent you.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Ah...
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Reverend Executor, if I could have just a moment.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: ...Baron Lukas. Please go ahead.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Those... violent thugs disturbing the peace on the streets are back?
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Alright, I got it. I'll send men over right away.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Uh... Of course, absolutely. I'll be there in person. Please rest assured that the Gendarmerie will keep you safe and maintain Leithanien's untarnished glory.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: ...As you can see, I'm a very busy man.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: I disagree. The social status of the informant should not be a criteria in determining the priority of your tasks.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Look, we're not in Laterano. Speaking of which, you're not allowed to freely fire your gun—or any other weapons—to intimidate the residents here.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: No, more than that. You'd best stay in my sight while you're operating in Zwillingstürme.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: I'm not aware of any such procedure.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You mean the rules? Rules are set by people.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: I'd like to raise an objection.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Then I'll have to arrest you at the first opportunity, Herr Federico.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: As someone who's fired multiple shots near a noble's private art gallery, many would see you as the biggest threat to Zwillingstürme's order.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: District of Bodenshof, Karl Schmidt Street.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Frieda Seemann, the deceased at the exhibition, resided here for many years.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Right. 'Marigold Alley,' a place beloved by both painters and poets.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Baron Lukas moved here two years ago. He claims he wanted to be closer to an 'increasingly rare artistic milieu,' but of course the real reason might be that the homes here are far cheaper than the ones on Innere Stadt.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: I find it very likely that my target has been here before.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Don't be rash. Remember our agreement? Arturia Giallo is a beloved and highly esteemed musician here in Leithanien.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: You're currently 'assisting' the Gendarmerie with an unrelated case, under the premise that whatever you find has nothing to do with me or my men.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: I have discovered the alleged gang of violent thugs reported to be disturbing the peace.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Immediately executing—
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Stay put!
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: I suggest we immediately initiate arrest procedures.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: It's just a bunch of kids who don't want to attend classes.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Get moving, all of you. No loitering.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: So you were here too. The instrument sculptures were built under the Kaiserinnen's orders, and vandalism will not be tolerated. You're also bothering everyone in the neighborhood with the sound of chiseling.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Still not stopping your Arts?
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: What the hell are you carving?!
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Can't you see? I'm just transforming the street back into its proper form.
attributes.name: Stubborn Apprentice

attributes.content: Twisted horns like those aren't allowed in Zwillingstürme... No, they're forbidden across all of Leithanien.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Step aside. We have to destroy them before the Empresses' Voices find out.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Destroy? What makes you think you're brave enough to destroy a symbol of Herkunftshorn?
attributes.name: Stubborn Apprentice

attributes.content: Herkunft— where did you learn that name?
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Plenty of people already know. He'll be back soon, after all.
attributes.name: Stubborn Apprentice

attributes.content: He was dethroned before you even learned to speak. You have no idea what those horns signify. Back then, he'd erect a sculpture like that on the streets whenever he killed a dissident!
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: ...Someone's already dead, aren't they?
attributes.name: Stubborn Apprentice

attributes.content: The painter who lived down the street. She was the first.
attributes.name: Stubborn Apprentice

attributes.content: Run away with your tail between your legs, meine Herr. Whatever courage you once had is ancient history.
attributes.name: Stubborn Apprentice

attributes.content: 'The first soldier to set foot in the Witch King's Spire'—do you really think you're still that same hero?
attributes.name: Stubborn Apprentice

attributes.content: Don't think I'll let you off just because you hit a nerve, schlingel...
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: He's gone.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Hmph, let him run.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Why did you not arrest him immediately?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Is there a point in rushing to fill up our prisons?
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: May I assume that your reluctance to arrest the boy was due to your personal feelings?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: ...I'm almost regretting my decision to bring you along, Reverend Executor.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Agreed. Freedom of movement would allow me to lock down the target as soon as possible.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: No, I meant I should have detained you in our office instead.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Why's there another one still here? Hey, junge. Make any more noise and I'll really bring you in.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: ...The twisted horn sculptures. Are you not going to clean them up?
attributes.name: Serene Apprentice

attributes.content: Right, I still have these troublesome things to deal with. I really don't get what youngsters have in their heads these days.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: They're nostalgic for an era they never got to experience in person. But there's nothing wrong with that. All Leithanians are entitled to feel disappointed with how things are today.
attributes.name: Serene Apprentice

attributes.content: For example... the coachmen casters who lost their jobs to Victorian automobiles, or the owners of the community theaters that closed down thanks to Wrankwood's film industry. Or their children, of course.
attributes.name: Serene Apprentice

attributes.content: When people see no way out, the only way they can imagine a future is by looking back at the past.
attributes.name: Serene Apprentice

attributes.content: Hah. Did you hear all that from some adult at home?
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: As if. I guarantee you she'd never say anything like that.
attributes.name: Serene Apprentice

attributes.content: All she knows is how to eliminate any threat to Leithanien at its source.
attributes.name: Serene Apprentice

attributes.content: The sculpture... shattered? And so easily...
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: He is clearly no ordinary student. I would recommend stopping him for questioning.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Hm. Nothing ordinary about him, that's for sure. But all the more reason to keep our mouths shut.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: ...And now it's actually raining, hah.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Want a drink? Coffee, or maybe beer? If we're drinking at this place, I recommend the former.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: I do not make a habit of consuming fluids that will affect my central nervous system while on a mission.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Alright, beer for me then.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: You are also—
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: On a mission, ja. Why else would I be drinking at this hour?
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: The child from earlier said that you were 'the first soldier to set foot in the Witch King's Spire.'
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: He's not wrong. What, want me to sign a napkin for you?
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: I would rather you sign the cooperation agreement I sent you.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Reverend Executor, how old were you twenty-three years ago? The news coverage on the coup can't have been bigger than the ads for some new dessert shop, can they?
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: 'The Lateran who became the captain of Zwillingstürme's Gendarmerie.' That's how the headline went.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You sure did your homework.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: I've paid no attention to your ties to the Witch King. The Loris Bordin I read about was a law enforcement officer worth working with, having solved one strange case after another.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Is that why you wrote me so many letters?
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Arturia's Arts are unusual, and you are well versed in handling similarly strange cases.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: In the year 1079, you arrested a gang of thieves proficient in casting illusions for romance scams. In 1085, you shot dead a dangerous hypnotist. In—
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Wait. Stop right there. Please don't take me for the protagonist of some detective drama.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: You appear to be avoiding the topic, Loris Bordin.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: And why would I do that? It's just that I accepted early on that I'm a loser.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Did you know? Jan, he... That uncooperative kid we ran into in Marigold Alley earlier, he had a sister who used to work here.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: She went missing fifteen years ago.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Judging by your special treatment of the young man, I assume the case remains unsolved.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: And that's not the only case I haven't been able to crack. Not the first, and definitely not the last.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: There's nothing special about it at all.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: It just... is.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Heh... A Notarial Hall executor like you probably hasn't experienced failure like that.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Herr Bordin! You're here again. How are things lately?
attributes.name: Shopkeeper

attributes.content: The doctor told me to give up drinking.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: That's a shame. To make a Lethanian man in his prime cut off his alcohol intake is just as bad as making him go deaf!
attributes.name: Shopkeeper

attributes.content: I even thought I'd give you a 50% discount if you brought the Damen und Herren from the Gendarmerie here for your retirement party.
attributes.name: Shopkeeper

attributes.content: You're retiring?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I'm leaving Leithanien once Das Kaiserinnensfest is over.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Thiem, what's that kid been up to lately?
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Jan? The Universität he applied to rejected him, so he probably went off to learn a proper trade.
attributes.name: Shopkeeper

attributes.content: He's pretty talented with Arts, and his grades in secondary school weren't bad either. So why wasn't he scouted by any of the universities?
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Because he threw away your recommendation letter.
attributes.name: Shopkeeper

attributes.content: That bengel...
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: He said you should be trying harder to find Yulia, rather than worrying about which school he's going to.
attributes.name: Shopkeeper

attributes.content: And also... *sigh* Actually, now that I've gone and said it, I think something's not quite right with the boy lately.
attributes.name: Shopkeeper

attributes.content: On the day he got your recommendation letter, he asked me why his father didn't need one back in the day. Said he'd entered a certain Graf's spire solely by his own abilities.
attributes.name: Shopkeeper

attributes.content: 'Talent was more important than lineage back when His Majesty was still around.' His words.
attributes.name: Shopkeeper

attributes.content: ...Where exactly has he been hanging out these days?
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Not sure.
attributes.name: Shopkeeper

attributes.content: The twisted horn sculptures.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: As you implied, Jan shouldn't have even known what they looked like. Which means someone else showed him first.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Oh, right. Which area used to have the highest concentration of those twisted horn sculptures?
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Hm, Gustav Park? Not far from here. They call it Forest Park these days.
attributes.name: Shopkeeper

attributes.content: You should head home early today, Thiem.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: Huh? Sure. Wait, Herr Bordin? Why did you give me your wallet? You could buy a whole year's worth of beer with this much!
attributes.name: Shopkeeper

attributes.content: Keep it. It's for Jan.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: He's a clever kid, and should go to a good university. That should be enough for him to leave Leithanien and go polish himself in Victoria or Columbia.
attributes.name: Loris

attributes.content: The rain stops.
The park fountains do not, not even when the rain was still falling earlier.

There are people sitting or standing under the trees in groups of two of three, most holding an instrument. Violins, flutes, cellos. They seem to be playing independently, but the resulting performance is a harmonious ensemble.
Melodies both soothing and mournful dance on the water and float through the trees.
When I was a child, I heard that Einwald was a vast stretch of black forest before the nomadic cities were built.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: And whenever someone important passed away, people would go deep into the woods to remember the departed while playing their favorite music.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I don't see you holding an instrument.
attributes.name: Bereaved Youth

attributes.content: When I returned to Leithanien, I brought nothing with me.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I used to believe I could play all manner of instruments, but later I met a teacher I respect, who was keen to tell me that I didn't understand the first thing about music.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: But what he meant was... I didn't understand emotions.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Back then, I couldn't comprehend how that was possible. My short life had clearly been brimming with more than enough loss and suffering.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: And then?
attributes.name: Bereaved Youth

attributes.content: And then... my friend died.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Then you must have felt true pain.
attributes.name: Bereaved Youth

attributes.content: To be honest, I'm still not sure I truly understood.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Then I left Leithanien and travelled the lands. I would play for the people I met, and their praise grew only more enthusiastic with every place I visited.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: But I haven't played anything specifically for my dear friend in a long, long time.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I'm sure they'd love to hear your performance, no matter what level you're at.
attributes.name: Bereaved Youth

attributes.content: I know. And precisely because I know, I hope I can improve.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Have I ever actually tried to stand up to anything in my life?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Can I honestly tell him, with my back straight and my head held high, that I lived a life full enough, rich enough... that it was worthy of his sacrifice?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I can't imagine how he would reply... because I'm not even sure what to say to him in the first place.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: And you, sir? Who do you hold in your heart when you come here?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: A mentor. He left us twenty-three years ago, but I never forgot him.
attributes.name: Bereaved Youth

attributes.content: He must have been a great man.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I heard that this park was established to commemorate the victims from twenty-three years ago. Every tree standing here replaced a twisted horn sculpture made of flesh and blood.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I have to admire them. During those dark times, they had the courage to stand up and resist fate.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Perhaps you're the same.
attributes.name: Bereaved Youth

attributes.content: A lot of the music we listen to is much older than even the entire history of Leithanien. The wills of the departed continue to live on in us, through their music.
attributes.name: Bereaved Youth

attributes.content: Live on in us... Right. I want to believe that.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Do you see that man standing over there?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You mean... the one carrying a sword, who's been following you?
attributes.name: Bereaved Youth

attributes.content: That's the one.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Do you know him?
attributes.name: Bereaved Youth

attributes.content: Serious, calm, lacking emotion.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Their faces always look so alike I don't even bother distinguishing them anymore.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: My time's up, isn't it?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: ...You certainly enjoy wasting time, 'Graf Urtica.'
attributes.name: Stern Youth

attributes.content: Wunderbar. So I didn't mistake you for someone else.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Truth be told, Herr Overseer, I did think I was ready for you when I first walked into the park.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: 'If Their Majesties want my life, then they can have it.'
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: After all... from then 'til now, and even for the foreseeable future— my life has never truly been a boon to anyone.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Did you come here to plan your suicide?
attributes.name: Stern Youth

attributes.content: I only considered it for a moment. Besides, if I'd pointed my wand at my throat you'd rush in to stop me, no?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: The Voice of Mundane has yet to play. So you cannot die.
attributes.name: Stern Youth

attributes.content: What a shame... No matter who I hear that from, it never makes me the slightest bit happy.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Can you hear that cello? I spent the afternoon reviewing my past through the sound of music, and myself on the water's surface.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: And my conclusion? My life really isn't worth any more than it was a few years ago.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: However, just like back then, no one can use it or manipulate it. Especially not—
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You people.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: What are you saying—
attributes.name: Stern Youth

attributes.content: An ambush?!
attributes.name: Stern Youth

attributes.content: Several black spheres conjured with Arts leap from the puddles in the area.
They had been camouflaged within the reflections of the trees in the water, and accompanied the melodies drifting through the air as they accumulated energy from the wobbly ripples.
—Ugh!
attributes.name: Stern Youth

attributes.content: So they sent a whole party just to execute me. Would you like me to perform a deep bow in appreciation of Their Majesties?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Sadly, I'm doomed to disappoint them.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I still haven't figured out when I'll play for him.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: But there is one thing I will absolutely tell him myself.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: 'I tried. I was always trying.'
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: 'I never stopped resisting.'
attributes.name: Ebenholz
